result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikell W Lay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mikell W Lay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order DENYING THE RETURN OF PROPERTY, signed and filed.
Petitioner Mikell W Lay in court.  Jennifer K Rhodes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIES order for return of property.
Return of property hearing at 12-23-2015 08:30 am
Milwaukee Co Sheriff's Office Inventory # NONE PROVIDED.

ADDRESS INFO for Mikell W Lay
Current: 3053 N 76th St APT #3, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 12-09-2015)
Prior: 3053 North 76th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53222

Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant pays the fine, has no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause, provides proof that the car defendant was driving at the time of the offense, has been junked and provides proof that the car he is currently driving does not have heavily-tinted windows.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $250.00 plus all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by 11/28/16 or the nonpayment penalty will be immediate entry of a civil judgment.  Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant pays the fine, has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause, provides proof that the car defendant was driving at the time of the offense has been junked and provides proof that the car he is currently driving does not have heavily-tinted windows.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Mikell W Lay in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Mikell W Lay in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mikell W Lay in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel, new attorney present. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT IS DOWN on August 25, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37 on September 17, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Mikell W Lay in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. CCAP entry reads defendant is not public defender eligible. For reasons stated on the record, Court referred defendant back to the Public defender's office for possible eligibility at this time.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mikell W Lay in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/8/15 @ 1:30 pm
